intro: Colysis bahupunctika, commonly known as the many-pointed colysis, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers. The plant features prominently veined leaves that are often covered in fine, soft hairs. Its blooming period occurs during the late spring to early summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
